oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A clinical picture of a naturally occurring Mycoplasma bovis outbreak in dairy steers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Barber, C.
Cornejo, S.
Talavera, M.
Lee, A.
Thoresen, M.
Meyer, F.
Vance, C.
Woolums, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mycoplasma bovis (M. bovis) causes serious disease in cattle worldÂ­wide, characterized by pneumonia, conjunctivitis, arthritis and mastitis. Antemortem diagnostics may help guide management of calves with M. bovis pneumonia, but detailed results have not been described. This report described the clinical and diagnostic progression of a naturally occurring M. bovis outbreak.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; Vol. 58 No. 58 (2024): 2024 AABP Annual Conference Proceedings; 199
